clinicalDescription: Overview: Loose, watery stools that occur more frequently than usual. Diarrhea is usually caused by a virus or, sometimes, contaminated food. Less frequently, it can be a sign of another disorder, such as inflammatory bowel disease or irritable bowel syndrome.Presentation: Frequent, loose, watery stools and belly pain.Plan: Replacing lost fluids with an oral rehydration solution (ORS) may help prevent dehydration. Over-the-counter antidiarrheal drugs such as Pepto-Bismol and Kaopectate may help. Prognosis: Most cases clear on their own. Some infections may need antibiotics. Severe cases can cause enough dehydration to require intravenous fluids.
